Description:
Who are Inchcape? At Inchcape, our vision is to have a connected world, in which our customers trade successfully and make better decisions in every port, everywhere. We use technology and our global network to help our partners connect to a smoother, smarter ocean.  Inchcape combines its worldwide infrastructure with local expertise through our global network of over 250 proprietary offices, across 70 countries and a team of more than 3,000 committed professionals. Our diverse global customer base includes owners and charterers in the oil, cruise, container, and bulk commodity sectors as well as naval, government, and intergovernmental organizations.  We have an ambitious growth model and a career here is certainly going to be a rewarding one that will allow you to bring your skills & experience. We embrace change and are open to new thinking and pushing for positive change in our industry.  
 We have an exciting opportunity for a Finance Manager in our Mumbai team. The role is an essential part of the Managed Services team for ISS, responsible for financial accounting and reporting across the  Global Hub in the UK and VSC Hub in MumbaiThe role will cover:
• Accountable for financial statements and accounting
• Business partnering with the management team
• Management of cash flow with the Finance Operations team. In particular receivables and sub-agent funding.
• Manage accounting processes with the team in the shared service team.
• Compliance with globally standardized processes for financial reporting
• Recognition of revenue in line with IFRS principles
• Revenue / Cost matching in monthly management reporting
• Adherence to Group Finance Policies as laid down in the Finance Manual
• Assist in managing Customer accounts and maintaining up-to-date statements.
• Preparation of analytical reports on Hub performance and track financial KPIKey Accountabilities:Financial Accounting & Reporting (40%)
• Ensure timely completion of reporting for the Managed Services
• Support the preparation and review of all monthly Actuals reporting (P&L and Balance Sheet) ensuring it is compliant with IFRS and Group accounting policies.
• Ensure the completeness and accuracy of all management reporting in Hyperion
• Ensure the accuracy of foreign currency accounting transactions in the system in accordance with the Group Finance Manual
• Support the development of new system developments, to drive improved compliance and efficiency.
• Have in-depth knowledge of the reporting systems (Hyperion & Unit4Financial) to be able to advise end users on reporting requirements through the system.
• Support the review of new IFRS requirements and/or regulatory issues and recommend how the business should prepare to meet them.
• Support the rollout of a robust Financial Accounting and Reporting control environment that adheres to the Inchcape Group policies and embeds best practices across the business.
• Ensure bank reconciliations are performed to reflect the correct position of the Global client contracts
Business partnering (20%)
• Provide best-in-class technical accounting advice to the team through constant guidance and optimization of process
• Support the identification and mitigation of accounting risks across the Group.
• Support the business by educating and advising them on how to use the accounting systems.
• Support ad hoc analysis as required by the Global teams, including Treasury, Tax, IT, Internal Audit, Legal and HR.
External Audit (20%)
• Support the group audit process by providing the required documents
• Support the team with guidance in preparing reconciliations and other work papers, including providing support to the Global Finance & Consolidation team.
Finance team development (20%)
Be an active part of the senior finance team for Managed Services and support the Hub operations Develop the team of GL accountants into a professional, high-performing function.Knowledge, Experience, and Skills:
Essential:
• Excellent knowledge of IFRS and statutory accounting
• Experience as a financial manager heading a team.
• Experience in financial risk management and enforcing control environment.
• Experience in working in a multi-national, multi-cultural organization.
• Excellent communication skills and a good command of the English language (oral and written)
• Experience in working on a group consolidation system.Desirable: Good to have but not mandatory
• Knowledge of the shipping industry
• Knowledge of Hyperion Financial Management system
• Knowledge of Unit4 Financial system
• Experience in project management
• Experience in managing a teamEducation and Professional Qualifications:
Essential:
• University degree in finance, accountancy, business
• Qualified and Registered Chartered Accountant (ACA /ACCA / CPA (or equivalent)Other Requirements:Essential:
